entity1.name: body language
entity1.description: Nonverbal signals or signs that are used in communication, such as facial expressions, gestures, and body language.;;;A form of communication in which physical behaviors, as opposed to words, are used to express or convey information.;;;Non-verbal communication through physical behaviors, expressions, and gestures used to convey messages or attitudes.

entity2.name: social interactions
entity2.description: The ways in which individuals engage with one another and the processes by which they influence each other's behavior and attitudes.

entity3.name: relationships
entity3.description: The connections or associations between two or more people, often characterized by emotional bonds, mutual interests, or shared activities.

entity4.name: smile
entity4.description: A facial expression characterized by an upward curve of the lips, often associated with happiness or friendliness.

entity5.name: happiness
entity5.description: A positive emotional state characterized by feelings of joy and contentment.

entity6.name: friendliness
entity6.description: The quality of being kind, welcoming, and approachable in social interactions.

entity7.name: furrowed brow
entity7.description: A facial expression characterized by the lowering and drawing together of the eyebrows, often indicating confusion or concern.

entity8.name: confusion
entity8.description: A state of mental uncertainty or disorientation where one is unsure about what to think or do.

entity9.name: concern
entity9.description: A feeling of worry, anxiety, or unease about a situation or problem.

entity10.name: proxemics
entity10.description: The study of the distance between individuals during an interaction, which can convey important cultural and personal cues.

entity11.name: professional settings
entity11.description: Refers to environments where individuals engage in work or business activities, often characterized by formal behavior and communication.

entity13.name: confidence
entity13.description: A feeling of self-assurance arising from one's appreciation of their own abilities or qualities.

entity14.name: authority
entity14.description: The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience, often associated with a position of leadership or expertise.

entity15.name: posture
entity15.description: The position in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting, often reflecting health, confidence, and attitude.

entity16.name: eye contact
entity16.description: The act of looking into another person's eyes while talking to them, which can convey attentiveness, honesty, and respect.

entity18.description: An estimated percentage of communication that is conveyed through nonverbal means, according to some studies.
